In my role as a project champion for {$project_name} I am acting

{$item}

In answering each of the following questions, please indicate the name(s) of the subproject(s) for which you are providing your comments. It is not expected that a project champion will be engaged with or knowledgeable about all of the subprojects in a project, although some project champions will want to comment on more than one subproject. Please include comments on all of the subprojects in which you are engaged.

Q1: Describe the research activities that are underway within one or more subprojects that are relevant to you or to your organization.

{$item}

Q2: Describe your (or your organization's) current and/or anticipated involvement in the planning and conduct of the research. Please provide specific details where possible.

{$item}

Q3: Describe the benefits that you (or your organization) expect to gain from the research and how it might impact the larger digital media community.

{$item}

Q4: From your perspective, how would you prioritize the project activities? What activities do you see as the most high-yield for your organization? Is there opportunity for other more interesting activities?

{$item}

Q5: In many cases, it is anticipated that partner organizations represented by Project Champions will be direct receptors of research outcomes and may (at some point) become contributing supporters of the research. What is the likelihood that, within the next two years, your organization will make a cash and/or in-kind contribution in support of this research. If there is such a likelihood, please describe what such a contribution might be and the conditions under which such a contribution might be made. Please be as specific as possible. Nothing included here will be considered a commitment regarding any prospective contributions.

{$item}

ReportSection.name: Review
ReportSection.Instructions: This section provides (a) an online document with all the information currently contained in the report pages, and (b) an online approximation of what the resulting PDF document will look like. If you are satisfied with this content, then you can proceed to the final step of the reporting workflow where you can "Submit" your report to be forwarded to the RMC.

ReportSection.name: Submit
ReportSection.tooltip: PDF generation and submission to the RMC
ReportSection.Instructions:
To submit your report, follow the following three steps.

  1. Generate a new report for submission
  2. Download the PDF document for your records.
  3. Submit your report: this step indicates that you have read and approve the contents of the PDF document to be forwarded to the RMC. Note that "submitting" does not lock the reporting workflow; you can regenerate and resubmit your report as many times as you wish before the deadline, if you need to make additional edits to your report. The most recently generated PDF is used for evaluation.
